column1: Symptoms of breathing in ("sniffing") glue fumes may include: - Anxiety - Convulsions (from breathing in large amounts) - Drunk, dazed, or dizzy appearance - Excitability - Headache - Irritability - Loss of appetite - Nausea - Red, runny nose Severe poisonings caused by swallowing glue may cause: - Gastric outlet obstruction (blockage of the passage from the stomach to the first part of the small intestine) with abdominal pain, nausea and vomiting - Intestinal obstruction (small and large bowel) with abdominal pain , nausea and vomiting
